website_summaries.verdict: The well-designed Jabra Elite 65t truly wireless earphones rival Apple's AirPods and are superior in some ways.
pros: The Jabra Elite 65t are smaller and fit more comfortably than their predecessors
They sound excellent for truly wireless headphones, perform reliably and are great for making calls, with two microphones in each earpiece
Battery life is decent at 5 hours and the included charging case delivers two extra charges
cons: The relatively tight, noise-isolating fit isn't for everyone
You have to step up to the more expensive Elite Active 65t to get a true sports model that offers enhanced sweat-resistance

customer_reviews.title: 3 Months in and I am sad.
customer_reviews.text: A few things. 1. These actually hurt my ears to have in for any length of time. 2. I've had them for about 3 months now and they no longer turn on or off when taking them out or replacing them in their charging case. 3. They randomly disconnect and reconnect, even when the phone is within 3ft. 4. If you want to use just one side you can only use the right ear. 5. The left ear has developed a buzz that does not go away. tl;dr : Would not buy again. Do not recommend. If you are going to spend this kind of money the product should last more than 3 months...
customer_reviews.author: The Browns

customer_reviews.title: Going on my 3rd pair....
customer_reviews.text: So... I'll be going on my 3rd pair now, trying to get one that doesn't have a terrible static issue in the left earbud. Tbh, if you're paying close to $200 for buds, they better work perfectly. These things are not worth the headache. Jabra's QC must be awful or just non-existent if this is an ongoing issue with their headphones. I don't see how anyone in QC would allow such terrible static in an earbud to pass off as okay.
customer_reviews.author: Vini A. Forcella

customer_reviews.title: Defective after a couple weeks, customer service doesn’t acknowledge anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted couple of weeks before I have problems. The earbuds won’t turn off/disconnect when I put them into the case which gets annoying. I miss notifications/phone calls when the earbuds are put away because they are pairing to my phone when they’re supposed to be off. I have sent several customer service requests and waited on hold for 30 minutes. There is no customer service. It’s a scam. They got my $200 and ran with it. Sound and battery are good at least.
customer_reviews.author: Avery J.

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing. I own the Bragi Dash Pros and these ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I own the Bragi Dash Pros and these take the cake...and they're cheaper too. Sound is above-average with decent bass and acceptable mids/highs. One of my biggest surprises was how loud these things can go. At three quarters from full volume, these things are plenty loud. Similar to Bragi's Audio Transparency (allowing you to hear surroundings when not playing music), Jabra does well with the HearThrough functionality. Not overly sensitive, the earbuds pick up just enough to hear outside sounds without blasting your eardrums.
customer_reviews.author: David Berino

customer_reviews.title: Terrible microphone quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrendous microphone quality. Impossible to use this device in a public area (or any area with ambient noise) for a telephone call without significant background noise which makes it impossible for you to be heard. Otherwise, the sound quality and connectivity are fine for music-only usage.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Broken after less than three months!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these for the 2.5 months that they worked. Sound and voice quality was superb and the fit was great. However, after about 2.5 months of use, the left earpiece just stopped working. Quickly thereafter the right earpiece stopped paring. I went through all of the troubleshooting tips on the Jabra website but nothing worked to restore sound in the left or pairing in the right. . . Emailed Jabra support but they couldn't do anything to help. I won't buy anything from this manufacturer ever again.
customer_reviews.author: James Ostendorf

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, poor support
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are wonderful and I really enjoyed the noise blocking effects while working around heavy machinery. The only problem is Jabra support. I have been trying to reach out to them for over a month via phone, email and even with Amazon's support and am nowhere near to a resolution. Somehow the right earbud has a problem that causes it to drop in volume after a while (heat?) so I can really only hear anything out of the left earbud. Since the right earbud is master, it is obviously still functioning well enough to send sound to the left, but it's not making (much) sound itself.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months, support dragging their feet
customer_reviews.text: I was originally pleased with these. The sound quality is decent and the range is great. Compared to the $50 Tranya the sound quality is better but I miss the Tranya's great magnetic case. I can't recommend these due to quality and support issues. After 2 months, My charging case stopped turning off the headphones automatically. Then the left earbud stopped connecting and has a lot of static. I contacted Jabra support and followed all their troubleshooting instructions to no avail. They had me fill out forms, take a photo of the device and weeks have dragged on with no response about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: BenB

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected after only 1 week of use!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have for a week and keeps disconnecting and connecting want stay connected long enough to listen to the music and sound quality is 2 out of 10 edit they have switched them out a couple of times and now I have a good pair! That stay connected!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Guinn

customer_reviews.title: Update the FIRMWARE!
customer_reviews.text: If you are having any problems with sound or in my case the left earpiece not working, download the jabra app on your mobile device, and update the firmware on your jabra earbuds, it solved my issues and they work great now.
customer_reviews.author: John Sydness

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for phone calls!!
customer_reviews.text: When trying to talk on the phone with these, not only can the other person not hear me very well, they can hear the ambient noise much better. The mics for ambience seem to be better for picking up ambiance than the voice mic for talking. Very dissapointed. Music on these are nice. But again, terrible for taking calls. Changing the settings does nothing to help. These are my second pair as I was hoping it was a bad pair. These are going back as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pouls29

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, Bad company
customer_reviews.text: These worked fine for about a week. The right earbud stopped turning off and charging when I put it into the case. I emailed Jabra customer support, and it took them two days to reply to me with generic software reset "fixes" on what is clearly a faulty hardware issue. This company does not care about you, only your money. Returning immediately, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud cuts out when running.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these headphones for not that long at all(A week or two) and the left ear cuts out when I’m running. It’s a shame because everything else about these earbuds are great, just not good build quality I’m assuming.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality still falls too low for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: Every thing about these is really nice except two big things. 1) the sound quality is subpar of what is expected from headphones that cost $100+. If true wireless can't provide better sound quality than that and with a lot less white noise then we're not ready for it yet. I got these because I didn't want the AirPod quality sound but this isn't good enough either. 2) these are very comfortable... when not using the buttons on the headphones, and when not laying down
customer_reviews.author: JAY.

customer_reviews.title: Manufacture support lacking if you experience issues
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked well, excepting fact that left headphone's volume is only at 75% or so of the right headphone ( tried switching ears to ensure this is a hardware error with headphones and not my hardware). Manufacture refused to provide a replacement, or a method to return product without cost to customer (me or you), though defect was reported within days of receiving product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a month
customer_reviews.text: Defective product. As many other reviewers mentioned, the left earbud went out and stopped working after about a month. Before it stopped working, I was very satisfied with the sound and how far I could be from my phone with good quality music. Unfortunately, the buds would wiggle out while working out and ended up being defective so it didn’t matter.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: These would be great - if they didn't have a really bad balance issue that makes them worthless
customer_reviews.text: Great materials. Good sound. Fantastic battery life. Unfortunately, none of that makes up for the issue so many people (including myself) are having with these. My left earbud sounds normal. My right earbud volume will never go high enough to hear clearly when there is any sort of outside noise, like traffic. Adjusting the balance doesn't help (it just will never get loud enough). Resetting to factory doesn't help. Updating the firmware does worse... they problem went from "bad" to "ridiculous" after the latest firmware release. This issue has been affecting people since day one of the product release. People who have sent them in for a warranty exchange report receiving a replacement with the exact same issue (multiple times).
customer_reviews.author: Basil Margherita

customer_reviews.title: Right earbud broken out of the box...so disappointing
customer_reviews.text: In terms of first world consumer problems, this one is pretty high on my list. Riding a wild high of consumerist dopamine, I ordered these bad boys with the fastest shipping possible to arrive at my place when I returned home from travel on Thursday. ALAS, they Arrived and the right earbud wouldn’t turn on. Amazon is sending me a new pair so I’ll update my review after they arrive if they work.
customer_reviews.author: The Faz

customer_reviews.title: They stopped working after a week. -WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I got my Jabra elite 65t on Black Friday, a week after I got them the right earbud stopped working no matter what I tried. yes, they were good for a few days but now I have no use in them anymore. I'm frustrated and don't know what to do, I use my headphones at work, gym, car etc... I feel like its a product you cannot trust, which is such a shame because it is an expensive product. after buying them I feel that I got cheated, scammed, and now I need to find a new solution from the beginning. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.
customer_reviews.author: nir ling

customer_reviews.title: Calls are bad but great for music
customer_reviews.text: Good: Sound quality and music Idea and software updates Bad: Not cheap for the price factor The person on the other end hears sounds around you more than you and it’s annoying It doesn’t disconnects if no activity like Bose so battery runs out quickly
customer_reviews.author: M. Soliman

customer_reviews.title: B/T connection drops repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on multiple reviews indicating a solid product. What i found was an endless cycle of dropped B/T connections while listening to music during my walks with the dog. Almost like crackling and other times just outright micro-drops (for lack of a better term) where it expands from mere annoyance to calling it a day and submitting the return request as I have finally done. Maybe my pair were a fluke but for $165 I'll stick to my Sony and deal with the wires. At least the music isn't endlessly cutting in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Guru

customer_reviews.title: Left earphone dead after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these earphones two days ago and now the left earphone won't charge, turn on, or anything. Very disappointed in this product. Definitely not worth the high price you are paying for it.
customer_reviews.author: frecklebob

customer_reviews.title: Losing connection while moving
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about it except how it loses connection when I'm moving. I put my phone in my pocket or in my bag and just walking, while listening to my music. It gets cutoff as you bounce. I believe somehow the Bluetooth connection distance is really limited or just pretty weak so that it gets disconnected, leaving me with constantly loss of audio. If I have my phone out, there is no problem. I did call in for a support and there was a firmware available at that time. Sadly the problem still exists... Again, the sound quality and the fit of the earbuds are superb. Come on, Jabra!
customer_reviews.author: Halbon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until the crackling starts
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome, until you start hearing crackling noises in the left earbud. Apparently this is a common problem; my first one had this issue immediately but I figured it was a fluke. The replacement worked flawlessly, so I bought the Active version (this one) and it was great for two months. Today it started with the crackling noise in the left piece, and it's not going away. Read other reviews; the problem isn't just me. The product is great but the quality control is absolutely awful.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: May be good for others but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I gave these buds two weeks. I looked at a lot of different true wireless sets for about a month before buying these. I was disappointed in them in the end and sent them back. Good: Sounds great Blocks outside noise fairly well Great battery life Easy setup Bad Painful ear fatigue {this is subjective, bad for me probably has good fit for others) Tend to want to fallout, especially with some sweat. Poor Bluetooth connection (would repeatedly lose signal while the phone was in my pocket) Can't use the left Bud by itself For the cost, I just couldn't justify keeping them. They were just too painful, wanted to slip out, and tended to have a poor connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mushraeddur

customer_reviews.title: They were great until...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son as a gift. He loved them! Until... The right earbud now doesn't realize when it is in the case. He can't tell if it is charging and it doesn't turn on when he takes it out of the case like it should. Bigger bummer - he contacted Jabra, got a ticket number, and now crickets... What gives? These aren't even a month old! It's not like these were $10 headphones. Have others had this same experience?
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Charging case is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds sound great, good fit, no problems with the earbuds themselves. The problem is the charging case. It’s just complete garbage. It won’t close, so you can charge the earbuds and they keep falling out unless you strap the case closed with rubber bands or something. Horrible design on the charging case, which leads to more problems with Jabra support. The charging case barely closed from day one, and now 8 months later it doesn’t close at all.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great when working
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable. have great sound, and with the sound app impressive base for buds. And they won't be mistaken for a medical device. The controls three buttons do everything easily. So it's all good so far. Then after two months or so I realized the imbalanced sound was not my hearing or my source but the fading right bud. It was replaced by Jabra. Good. Then when reading the manual I see that the case is supposed to have a light that indicates state of charge or if an upgrade is in progress. I don't have this and it turns out this will not be taken care of because it's almost six months old. Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.author: alfa

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit, hate the product! Left ear has a hiss and then the audio drops out almost completely. I've only had them for 3 months. I use them for about an hour before work while getting ready around the house. That's not even 100 hours of listening! For that price and the amount of time used I should've gone with the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love the Quality and Style Design of these Jabra Elite 65t
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical on purchasing these since I've never heard them before, but I loved the discreet and stylish design of them, so I took the plunge and bought them. That decision was one of the best I've ever made on Tech. These sound amazing, fit incredibly comfortable, have noise cancellation, with the option of Hear Through technology, which allows you to still hear your surroundings while listening to your music. They're just as amazing on phone calls. crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fingerz

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping!!
customer_reviews.text: Like others, my Jabras lose their connection even when the "broadcasting" unit (be it cell phone or otherwise) are in close proximity. It has become so annoying that I reverted back to wired buds (but just ordered Samsung's new BT buds because of recent favorable reviews). BTW, I did narrow the problem being with the Jabras by using other BlueTooth headsets, etc. with the same "broadcast" units and had ZERO dropouts even up to 30 feet. I should have returned day one...now they're off to Goodwill or the landfill. Sad...and at such a great cost!
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: Not what you’re hoping for...
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after half dozen uses. Sound is ok, but not nearly loud enough vs high-end wired ear buds. Returned and refunded with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within 10 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: The left warped completely died within 10 weeks. I paid a lot for it to just die 10 weeks in. Pretty frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds, low profile, solid build, excellent sound, long battery life, and comfortable wearing for up to an hour or two at a time. The extra, quick recharges inside the case are also nice. The included app for iPhone is well made and includes a sound equalizer, among several other nice features. However, I don’t care for having the name “Jabra” being boldly engraved into the outside center of both earbuds - it makes me feel like a walking billboard advertisement. The case also needs to be redesigned, to include charging light(s) on the opposite side of the charge port. Including a USB-C charging port and cable would also be better than the current mini-USB charge port and cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought in May 2018. Left one died today 9/23/18. RIP. Past warranty. You'd expect for expensive ear buds they'd last longer or have a more confident warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting experience
customer_reviews.text: They got stuck in my ears and I had to go to a walk-in clinic to get them removed, so I am deducting one star. However, I am adding a star for the noise cancellation feature because I could not hear my girlfriend yapping about how handsome Paul Hollywood from the British Baking Show is for the few hours that they were stuck in my ears. It was an interesting Tuesday to say the least! The sound quality was not too good, it sounded like a cat meowing into a soda can. Overall would recommend to a friend or relative with larger ear holes and poor hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Good for listening to music/audio - Bad for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: These Jabra earbuds have very good audio quality for listening to music, audio podcast or youtube videos. However, I found them to not be adequate for conference calls. The audio for calls is good on the Jabra user side, but the person on the other end, oddly, hears themselves In echo. This was tested across many different calls and conference methods, always with the same result of person on the other end of line hearing themselves in echo. The battery life has averaged around 3 hours 45 minutes before you have to put back in the case . You get two charges per full case charge.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Avoid these.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality, volume control, form factor, in the end none of those matter when they simply do not work. Out of the box and then charged, they linked easily, but the left earbud would not produce sound. It would adjust the volume and was recognized by the app, but only with some fiddly motions of putting it in and out of the charging case would the left earbud occasionally produce sound. Charging them or turning them off immediately caused the left one to stop working again. An internet search to see if I had inadvertently turned it off revealed that this is a known issue with no resolution. Junk, junk, junk. Don’t waste your money or your time on these.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product but bad support
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are good but unfortunately, I received one with a defect. My left earbud always disconnects whenever it is 3-5 cm away from the right one. Which renders it completely useless because obviously between the left and right ear are about 25-35 cm away from each other. I called Jabra support and they never answer the phone, their support it is total trash. It is a real shame because they made such a great product. Obviously, I will never purchase from this brand ever again. So if you want to buy this product I really suggest you go to the stores and test them out. Do not order these online.
customer_reviews.author: Yao-Wei Liu

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Initially these earbuds were working fine except for few connectivity issues. In few months, the volume from left earbud kept getting lower and eventually stopped working within like 8 months. Reached out to the customer care and they kept saying me to follow same steps I usually follow and eventually they also stopped responding and closed the case. Now even when the earbuds doesnt power off when I place them back in their case and continue to be connected with my device and drain the battery further. Heavily disappointed with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at all...
customer_reviews.text: Clearly for the $170, you're paying for newer technology...not technology that works well. First, can only connect to a smartphone, not a pc or mac...so it's very limited. I was hoping to be able to watch movies on the laptop or play games. Secondly, when listening to music on my smartphone...the quality sounds like a $10 pair of wired earbuds. Very poor quality for what I expect in ANY headphones. Will be returning these and finding others like the Sennheisers or waiting till the technology is actually quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: After 3 weeks, left earphone stopped working
customer_reviews.text: My real rating is zero stars. It worked great at the beginning. All the features were easy to learn. The battery life is amazing. Then, after 3 weeks the left earphone stopped working. If I press the plastic lightly, it works intermittently, like if there is some loss contacts. I wish there was a way to search in the reviews for Quality products specifically. I searched for the best reviewed products and the "Value" ones get prioritized by the system. Lots of people buy the cheapest ones and of course they are good..... for the price. But reading in detail, all of them last short. Still trying to identify the best wireless earphones for Android phone. Not the best "value"
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best earbuds I've used to date. They fit well in the ear and are not uncomfortable. In fact, I've left them in without realizing I wasn't listening to anything or on a call. They sound great and call quality is leaps and bounds superior to other earbuds (including Apple AirPods). Noise cancelling is very good but there is a bit of hissing when using the pass-through feature. Other than that, they last incredibly long and I can go a few weeks without having to recharge the case (with light to moderate use). I've recommended these to friends and they love them just as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wanted true wireless ear buds for the gym. After researching for about a month on youtube videos, I decided to take a gamble on these. They work exactly as advertised. The materials feel solid, not fragile. The sound quality is great. The battery life is what I expected. The case is sturdy and fits in my pocket easily while working out. The call quality is great on my Samsung Note 8. I've had them for a week now without any issues. The best part is I'm not stuck at the gym listening to their R&B music while I'm trying to work out. And they never feel like they're going to fall out while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin R.

customer_reviews.title: Good pair for sound and phone use, sports purpose, meh...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Jabra for a while and bought these pair to try the true wireless headphones plus the value. Pros: fits pretty well, good sounds quality and easy to set up and use Cons: battery life is about the same compared to Jabra pulse sports (maybe a bit longer) , no heart rate sensor and it doesn’t work with jabra sport app. So if you looking for a pair alternative of apple air pods it maybe good choice, athletic wise, except for its water proof ability and sound, I am happy with what I have been using so far. Nothing to special about this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jinjiang Li

customer_reviews.title: Great--Except Right Earbud Keeps Failing (3 times in 1 year)
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Elite 65t earbuds. Except--the right earbud keeps failing. After a few months of use, suddenly the volume level will plunge. I know, first thought is wax buildup. But I cleaned it out, that didn't make a diff. Here's the other thing: it's sporadic. Sometimes, when I first start using the buds, the right volume will be normal. But then suddenly it will plunge. By plunge, I mean maybe 20% of the volume of the left one. Of course I've tried the obvious factory reset. Now about to return the third one in 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: mondegreen

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are defective right out of the box. They keep losing volume in the left ear, so I'm left tilting my head in awkward directions to get them to work correctly. Also, the static issue in the left ear is very much real. Thankfully, I'm still within the Amazon 30 day return window so they are definitely going back. I don't even want a replacement from Jabra because of the less than glowing reviews of their customer service. I have owned $50 truly wireless headphones that worked better than this. I will be sure never to purchase another Jabra product.
customer_reviews.author: pm

customer_reviews.title: Fall out of my small ears easily
customer_reviews.text: I tried all three bud sizes. Not a one kept the relatively heavy buds in my ears as I shook my head. I didn't turn them on, just packed them up for return. They just cost too much to mess with that. Normally I wouldn't review on fit alone, but others have had this issue. I've got relatively small ears. Usually the large gels solve any poor fit issues, but these things are just too heavy for it to matter. I can't say don't try them, but definitely have a low threshold for sending them back for not fitting. Decide before the return window is up. I already had another pair in mind as a backup plan.
customer_reviews.author: geth1138

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than Air Pods
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, amazing sound, excellent base, crystal clear mids and highs, perfect syncing. Was really looking at the Apple Air Pods and read lots of reviews and watched quite a few YouTube comparisons. These won all the comparisons against the pods, and they have WAY more features, including volume control, next and previous song, hear through so you can hear what’s going around you if you turn it on, equalizer, which works amazing. I am very, very picky about sound quality, buy these, you will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these just over a year ago after reading the wirecutter recommendation and right as they passed the year mark they failed. The left earbud has completely lost consistency of volume and none of the tech support recommendations have repaired the situation. While one bud works as normal the other irregularly lowers its volume from 100% down to about 20% and with no rhyme of reason. I have read on forums that it's a surprisingly common issue due to the chips they use. I would recommend you avoid these, as I'm assuming you'd like something that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: $172 dollar and 11 months later dead
customer_reviews.text: The 65t has been a good set of earbuds. There have been issues at times. High pitch whine when taking out of case, that cause the sound to have a distorted sound. Fixed by putting back in case, closing cover and re-inserting into ears. Happens all the time. Cracking and popping sounds intermittently. Now the left earbud is really low. I can adjust volume, and skip or go back on tracks, but I can barely hear the left earbud. Putting pressure and lifting up the earbud brings back the sound, but as soon as I let go the sound goes to very low. I wish I could return them.
customer_reviews.author: jnmn98

customer_reviews.title: Great sound; doesn't fit my ears
customer_reviews.text: I really like the sound quality of these earbuds. The controls are pretty easy too. My biggest issue has been that they don't fit or stay properly in my ears. It's mostly my left ear too. I can get it sorta stay if I'm just listen to music or watching something on my elliptical. But out walking and especially talking on the phone, they tend to fall out (the left one more so than the right one). I've followed the instructions and it's frustrating that I've had them for this long and can barely use them the way I want to.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Good microphone, decent audio, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: Only get if you're looking for call/microphone quality. They don't cancel noise anything like the Bose products I use, however the microphone is much better than Bose. I use my Bose on the plane and when I listen to music and Jabra for video/phone calls. Jabra support is terrible, good luck trying to get a hold of them. The right ear unit lost audio quality, through the app I tried to get tech support no one replied for days, I hounded them through new tickets and days later they sent another link to get a warranty process going and still fighting through the process. All the way through they put up road blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase these ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in late November. They have very low volume, they have zero low frequency representation and they sound like a 1973 landline handset as far as dynamic range...and that's with music. I bought a 49.00 pair of Ankers that embarass these ear buds. Save your money and buy something else, they are absolutely not worth the price of admission. Comfortable, absolutely. Light, absolutely..dont even feel them in your ear. Problem is, you dont hear them either. I'm a 30 year sound engineer and am well qualified to tell you these are absolute garbage. All the equalization and adjustments in the app made little to no difference. They just simply shouldn't be purchased.
customer_reviews.author: RhodeIslandRed

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not what I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: The units aren't bad as far as aesthetics. The sound isn't bad but greatly lacks base, even with base boosted and treble lowered. The fit with the limited number of eartips wasn't horrible but could have used three sets of foam as well. The battery life is awesome. Just ordered a set of Comply to see if it improves the sound quality as well as the fit. I do like them but they leave a lot on the table. I compared these with my 8 year old Monster Turbine Pro Copper (wired) ear buds. I thought the technology would have improved the sound performance but not even close.
customer_reviews.author: GregS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like the case for the plugs and the style and fit of the plugs. They paired up quickly and easy The sound is average at best. Even with the equalizer on the app, it was still very tinny. The battery life is not nearly as long as advertised. I sometimes only get an hour or two even after freshly charged. I expected much better sound and performance for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Watson

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable earbuds in the market! (I’ve done the research!!)
customer_reviews.text: Best affordable earbuds in the market. I wanted to buy a new pair of affordable earbuds (<$100) and did tons of research to conclude these were the Best Buy. And they were!! They work well with my Microsoft Surface and Apple iPhone. Both devices can be connected at the same time which allows me to toggle between video calls and phone calls easily. Additionally, connecting is extremely fast with saved devices thus I don’t waste time when toggling from speaker to earbuds. Also, the Sound+ app is an incredible touch - allows you to switch between noise cancellation or not and let’s you change the audio settings (more or less bass) All in all, don’t think, just buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, VERY Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Like others have written, I really wanted to like these earbuds. They sound amazing and do a good job of blocking outside noise---IF you can get them in your ears just right AND IF they decide to stay in your ears. These kept sliding out of my ears little by little as I worked out, so I had to keep adjusting them (pushing them back in) every 10 mins. At one point without adjustment for 30 mins, one fell right out. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: FunShop

customer_reviews.title: No customer support
customer_reviews.text: I must revise my review of this product. When they work, they work well. The first set I had the right earbud could not produce sound. Jabra replaced the Elite 65t, but it took 5 weeks to get them replaced. I have been on the phone waiting for support to answer for over an hour. Submitted a online ticket no response. Now I am out of 160.00 for a pair of earbuds that don't work. I will need research other alternatives for webex/Microsoft teams conferencing calls
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your $
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this I was excited to see a competitor in the market but sadly I was mistaken. The left earbud always sounds slightly faint in the sound quality compared to Bose or even Beats is downright terrible. Sound quality is decent but when listening to music it is very mono and flat even with equalization. To have the battery life is mediocre and I have found the charging case allows you one extra charge. One thing that was disappointing is not knowing when the air buds are fully charged. I will not be a returning customer of Jabra products.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wireless sound
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sound! By far the most important feature for me was sound quality and these headphones have it in spades. Bass is great, nice crisp highs and no mid muddling. Battery lasts 5+ hours consistently. Fit is very secure despite the lack of inner ear prongs and they do not fall out even when running or mountain biking. Bluetooth connection never skips or drops. Tested many brands and these came out on top.
customer_reviews.author: Clayster

customer_reviews.title: Good Seller - product leaves a little to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Seller delivered in 2 days and as promised condition (new) The disappointment came with the phone call quality on my end and the receivers end. They can't hear me unless I have both earbuds in and I have to speak at a higher volume. and hearing the person I am talking to is not very good either- very hollow sounding, even when i use the sound app equalizer to adjust the sound quality. Lots of websites rated these high, but not for me. Amazon Prime rocks as always and I am returning these to Kohl's and think I might try the AirPods
customer_reviews.author: Z-Dawg

customer_reviews.title: So far great
customer_reviews.text: Seriously good sound for such a small ear bud. Had issues with blue connecting to two devices but tech support helped me out with a unit reset. Comfortable in the ear, don’t poke out like Mushrooms the way the Bose Sports do (which are the most comfortable in ear headphones), and don’t look like your brains are leaking out of your ears like the iPods. These are not noise canceling but the noise rejection from the fit is very good. Walked around costco and couldn’t hear a thing.
customer_reviews.author: BTS

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m gonna start with what I don’t like cause there’s only 1 thing: when you’re on a call, the people on the other line can hear everything around you. Ok now the good stuff! I felt compelled to write a review because I accidentally washed the left bud in the washing machine today (it was in a pocket) aaaannnd it still works!!! I’m not sure if they’re waterproof but it looks like it! 20min in the wash. Comfortable, stay in no matter the exercise and I go pretty hard sometimes, rarely need recharging. I also bought the used ones for $103 (instead of $160) and I see absolutely nothing wrong with them! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: adi16

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love these earphones. The convenience of true wireless is so nice, and the sound quality is very good. I hear parts of my music in a new light constantly, and the balance between lows, minds, and highs sounds really good. The only issue is that they don't connect to my Fire HD 8, but that's a (IMO) glaring fault of the device and has nothing to do with the earphones themselves. Just be aware of it if you're thinking of using them with a Fire device; I'm not sure how they interface with other tablets. Being able to pause and tap into background sounds is really useful too. I'm really glad I splurged on them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Enos

customer_reviews.title: Sound balance issue continues to be a problem even w/ latest 2.25.0 firmware
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Great battery life - Compact case - Amazing noise isolation (even better than Sony SP-700N active cancellation) - Sound+ app is well designed - Stable connection Cons: - Major issue is with the sound balance (google: "Elite 65t balance"). The issue persists even with the latest 2.25.0 firmware and seems to be more pronounced in the higher frequency range, meaning simply re-balancing amplitude left to right still doesn't feel balanced. - The ear tips are shallow and feel insecure
customer_reviews.author: kylehase

customer_reviews.title: Stupid and Finicky
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for my Bluephonic earbuds. Looking back, my bluephonic earbuds lasted two years, and the only reason I bought these was that I lost one of the earbuds. I digress, I bought these at the recommendation of someone techy. While they have a fantastic quality, they are finicky to connect to Bluetooth, and the right earbud needs to be connected for the left earbud to work, which is different from my last pair. I am hoping that I am just getting old, and technology is eluding me, and I get the hang of them. Until then, I give it three stars for the difficulty of connecting to devices.
customer_reviews.author: J McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Broke for no reason, and Customer support SUCKS! Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: My earbuds broke after a couple of months for no reason - there was no sound from one of them and I called their customer support. They asked me to send mine in (which I did) to receive a new replacement. I have sent mine, but have not received ANYTHING in return after WEEKS (almost 2 months now). They say there is NO definite date they can estimate I will receive them... this is a joke!!! stay away from Jabra because of their terrible customer support. I have heard Apple or Sony are much better.
customer_reviews.author: maghsoud

customer_reviews.title: The best customer service i have ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: So I had these for about 4 months and the left bud stopped working. Keep in mind I never bought a warranty. I sent an email to customer support and without hesitation they gave me a prepaid shipping label to send them back with. They sent me a brand new pair, and aside from that one issue, i haven't had a single issue. These have the best fit out of any wireless earbud i have tried. They will feel big at first, but after a few days, you stop noticing they exist. the noise cancellation is perfect and the pass through sounds great. Sound quality is amazing, especially compared to Airpods. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: No good for business calls
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile. The sound is good. The fit can be a little uncomfortable, but nothing intolerable. My issue is that these HAVE to work for business calls. If I can't use them in an airport or on a busy street or in a coffee shop, they're no good to me. My boss says to me as soon as we're on a call, "I'm getting alot of background noise. Can you drop the wireless earbuds?" They're going back. Buying AirPods - even though I wouldn't give Apple a dime if I could avoid it. In this case, it seems I can't avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for voice calls as well as entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I needed these most for top notch voice calling audio and mic, with a secondary need for music/video audio. They delivered. I would go so far as to say that these have the best mic for calls that I have come across and just for that I would recommend them. Beyond that the audio and the adjustable setup and modes via the iPhone app make these fantastic. Certainly not cheap but not as expensive as some others, and *so* much better for calls than other Bluetooth mic/in-ear buds that I tried. Noise canceling with the ability to control how much ambient sound to let in is a great bonus feature too.
customer_reviews.author: N. Porter

customer_reviews.title: One bud is dead after ~9 months of moderate, careful use, does not play well with smaller devices
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed with how poor the quality of these earphones turned out to be. They worked fine at first and connection is very strong from my phone, but connecting to other devices like my Garmin 645 or my Mighty player is an atrocious experience. Just lowering my wrist is enough to disconnect from the watch, even without any other obstructions. I have been very careful using the headphones, taking them always from my ears to their case, but already one of them gave out for no apparent reason. I regret going with the cheaper option instead of getting a pair of Jaybirds. Now I'll have to get something decent anyway and this is money wasted, pretty much.
customer_reviews.author: XGibran

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: I expected a lot more for the price. The right ear bud "popped" several times before it cut out altogether after pairing with my iPhone. Now it pretty much doesn't work at all or at such a low volume as to be non-functional. I quit listening to music with the Jabras and now just listen to podcasts with them. This occurred within six months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Polk

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but wired products are much better.
customer_reviews.text: I can't compare these to other wireless Bluetooth earbuds because I haven't used any. I relied on the review at the Wirecutter website which said these were the best they tested, so they are probably pretty good. But the sound quality is much worse than you get with wired earbuds, even the cheap ones that came with the phone. I also have some Sennheiser headphones and these are far, far better than the Jabra. But for listening while running or doing work with your hands, wireless ear buds are much less hassle. For listening while sitting down, the wired products are much, much better.
customer_reviews.author: H. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Works really well so far...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these so far. I was a little leery based on the negative reviews, but I'd just returned a pair of $35 knock-offs with horrible sound, and wanted something for workouts. I've used the earbuds on a couple of walk/runs and once at the gym for a strength training workout, and so far, they're fantastic. Great sound, and they stay put and are comfortable for 70 minutes. I haven't used them yet for a phone call. I'll update the review if something else comes up.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Syndergaard

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a couple weeks and the battery life is poor. They go from 80% to turning off in no time using the app to monitor battery life. There is no noise cancellation and the through noise the app allows you to adjust doesn’t do a thing. Nor does the equalizer options, no change from one setting to the next. I was excited about the fit, they stay in even through strenuous workouts but the battery life barely lasts a couple hours forget five as advertised. For the money I’m going to stick with headphones with the wire attaching the two ear buds because they hold up to their claims.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Sound will be higher in one ear
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for the gym. Turns out, these headphones have a problem with sound levels. Mine had volume higher in the left ear than the right ear. Downloaded new firmware for it and it still have volume differences. For the price I paid, it shouldn't be an issue, but sadly was. Even the sound quality was poor with a weak bass. Luckily amazon accepts returns for this within the first 7 days. Apperently I'm not alone with the volume differences, a quick google search shows that many people experience this with no fix. Don't waste your money on this and get something different.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Competitive sound, features, and price
customer_reviews.text: Upfront, these are great truly wireless headphones. Excellent sound and features. You can use just one or both. It is reassuring that I have no need of panicking if they get wet. Once paired, simply removing them from their case automatically connects them to your device. The pass-through feature is excellent. However, I only give it 4 stars for the following two reasons. The case shape makes it roll easily and the buds are still a little too large for my liking and ear shape. These are minor inconveniences for a product much cheaper than the high end products but still delivers comparable sound and features.
customer_reviews.author: Paule P.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set of wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The first set that I received had skipping issues with playback, but the second replacement set has functioned with absolutely no issues. They are light, stay in the ears well, have very good sound, and hold a decent charge even without the rechargeable carry case. I like both the noise-canceling feature and the passthrough sound options. The volume function on the left earbud is a little bothersome as its use causes the earpiece to work farther into the ear, but it isn't horrible. All in all I am pleased with the purchase and would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Okay earbuds not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I honestly had high hopes since it had great reviews but it fell short of my expectation. Since it has Bluetooth 5.0 I expected minimal sound cut off but for some reason randomly the left bud will keep disconnecting, and the connection just sucks, when I have it in my pocket it will constantly cut off. The actual sound is pretty great but I'm not an audiophile. You need to make sure you twist it in to keep secure, but honestly it won't fall out of your ears. The app itself looks pretty great but I didn't find myself using it much.
customer_reviews.author: Antsar L.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Happy
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good headphones. Really satisfied with the performance and they sound on par with my ol lady's Bose Soundsport. They come with a downloadable app that's great. They have a locating feature, hear through ( which I love and allows you to hear surrounding noise without taking the product off), and different sound modes. Amazon has you rate the noise cancelling, but they're definitely not noise cancelling. They're noise isolating, which they do pretty well. Really snug fit in your ears without causing irritation. I think that varies from person to person. Overall 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Jesús

customer_reviews.title: Started out good - Right bud Quit working after 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: INITIAL REVIEW: They are a little larger than I was expecting but they stay in place and the sound quality is good. The battery life is awesome too. I can use them for Two weeks worth of workouts in the charging case before recharging the case. Overall great product. Wish they were a bit smaller. REVISED REVIEW: Right earbud stopped working after 3 months. For a product that costs $140, they should be more reliable. In the process of dealing with support. So far, not a happy camper. I just want my money back at this point for a different product. Would not recommend anymore...
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. Broadstone

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t stay in my ears
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to pair with my TV while on my treadmill, so my husband can sleep through my workout. Unfortunately, even with the smallest sized earbud, I only got them to stay in successfully one time, so I had to send them back. Otherwise they were great and I’m sorry they didn’t work for me. I’m still on a mission to find something with this quality that will stay in my ears.
customer_reviews.author: OnLakeOntarioNY

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, difficult synch.
customer_reviews.text: The Jabras fit my ears well and produce a full rich sound. I've worn them on 5 mile runs and they stay securely in my ear. it also has great battery life, due to the convenient charger case in which they sit when not being used. My only frustration has been with a difficulty it has in synching up with my Apple Watch and iPhone. I go back and forth between the two and the bluetooth synch is always problematic, requiring many attempts until it is recognized. It's a waste of time and after owning Beats earbuds, seems like a ridiculous step backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Studebacher Hoch

customer_reviews.title: Water Resistant
customer_reviews.text: I like these headphones, as they have a nice long battery life, and a very quick recharge time when in the case. The microphone isn't the best, though, and these aren't great headphones if you are listening to music. I listen to a lot of talk radio or comedians, so this isn't a big issue for me. One thing that did surprise me ... I accidentally put these through the washer. I realized it when I was putting clothes in the dryer. Both earphones had fallen out of the case during the wash. But, there wasn't any damage and both earphones (and charging case) still work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Fall out of ear constantly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these earbuds sooooo much! But I could never get them to stay in my ear. They come with 3 different size ear adapters, but none seem to help me. I just sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: PCH

customer_reviews.title: Better than AirPods
customer_reviews.text: These pair, and stay paired, much better than my AirPods. Battery life seems good, on par with the AirPods. I can keep the volume lower because it seals better in my ear, which leads to a better sound for me. I lost these for a few months in my couch, when I finally found them, they still had charge, and paired immediately. Definitely get these over AirPods.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a noise cancellation person when it comes to earbuds, but this has to be hands down the best cancellation earbuds out there. If you’re looking for some earbuds to use in the gym or at work and be fully in the zone; These are the earbuds for you. Sound quality is perfect, noise cancellation is over the roof, and it also comes with its own app which I think is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos I Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed except.....
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome as long as you do not chew, yawn, swallow, sneeze, cough, chew gum, chew gum while walking, run, blow your nose, speak, talk or move your head from side to side. Also, don't run with scissors! I've tried all sizes of ear buds included but the Jabras fell out of my ears within seconds if I did any of the above! Sitting at my desk, on a plane, laying in bed... maybe they are ok. But otherwise they are useless and will inevitably be lost!
customer_reviews.author: ECHO444

customer_reviews.title: The perfect exercising / outdoors earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: Great for exercising and outdoors!! True noise cancelling; you can change configuration as well with their app and customize how much outside sound you want it to pass through! I hear almost every type of music and equalizers and balance are great on these ones! For phone calls, sound and compatibility is perfect! The only thing is that the microphone do not reduce outdoors sounds, so the person on the other side of the call hear a lot of noise + you voice; better to take phonecalls in a quiet place. Anyways, it is fully recommended for exercising or just listen to music!
customer_reviews.author: Monica B

customer_reviews.title: Sound cuts in and out
customer_reviews.text: Bought these headphones during the holiday sales for a great price. Really nice features and high quality sound. They work fine if you aren't moving much... When moving with these earphones the sound cuts in and out very frequently for both ear pieces. I've downloaded all the software for my Pixel 3, updated the earphones, and re-paired them multiple times but nothing has solved the issue. My old bluetooth headphones worked fine during my commute (which hasn't changed) without noticeable issues.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B.

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these on a constant basis, especially when driving (I only use one). I have small ears and they fit great. Took some time getting used to at first, but that only lasted a week. The sound quality is really good and the hear through feature is even better. Battery logs and charge life is top notch. I tans to use them up and have to do a full recharge, which takes time, but I’m ok with that. I love these way more than Apple EarPods. Those hurt my ears and slip out to easy. I’d recommend Jabra anyway over all other earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Jax D

customer_reviews.title: Designed to break
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly good. Price point is reasonable for this type of tech. But major problems: 1. Soft touch silicone: This shows fingerprints and it will liquify and turn tacky within a few years. Thus artificially shortening the life of the product. I don't know why manufactures are still overusing this material. 2. Hard-click buttons: Should have been touch sensitive or accelerometer tech. Your ear will HURT every time you have to press them. 3. Software features: Even in the short time I had them, Jabra modified how HearThrough works. Formerly, you could modulate the volume louder or softer. Now you can't.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Easily top notch earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. My ears are on the small side so the left one fits pretty tight. That being said, my right ear fits perfectly and I don't even notice it inserted. Has really good sound and feels well built. I like that they don't stick out really far which makes them less noticable. The battery lasts longer than I need and I like the way the case charges them automatically. Phone calls work and the other person never complains about how I sound. For the truly wireless earbuds, these are the best ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: T Dewitt

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with them originally
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these products for quite a while. In the beginning I was very pleased with them because I didn't know better. By now I purchased other similar earbuds and at that price range these just won't compete. What I'm saying is that there are newer and better products out there. These Jabras are outdated by now. Comparing them to others, they are uncomfortable and the sound quality is just so-so. I still like them, because they introduced me to the true wireless earbuds. I would like to see how the newer Jabras are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Oszkar Karai

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work well for their intend use. The should is good and the in call sound is not bad either. The mic is lackluster. I use them on 2 phones at the same time and Bluetooth does drop from time to time and then comes right back and will say "2 devices connected". Its only a short interruption but it is an interruption no the less. over all if I was going to use them for one phone and just listening to music and the occasional phone call I'd buy again. 2 phones.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: software features are really glitchy
customer_reviews.text: so for the most part, i love these buds. the way they fit in my ears is like no other. id have returned these by now if it werent for this great design and sound quality. the issue it with compatibility with my phone. i cant use the buttons to pause or resume play music. sometimes i have to restart my phone to get them to connect at all. i know its not my phone because ive got a couple pairs of buds, and this is the only pair that gives me these problems. maybe there's a way around this, but i havent discovered it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward P.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty decent product, but not worth the money. After now using these for six months, I am dissapointed in them. They don't reliably stay in my ear like other head phones do, which is dissapointing as they're list as an active headphones. The buttons on the devices are a little finicky and don't work every time. As headphones they are fine, the microphone is pretty poor and people often complain they can't hear me. Every else works as you would expect, but nothing wows you. Overall dissapointed with this purchase and I'll be moving onto other headphones soon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Second Ear Bud Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The first was the Mifo O5 Bluetooth 5.0 IPX7. They were glitchy and stopped syncing frequently, when I couldn't take it anymore I sent them back and bit the bullet and ordered these. Long story short these are everything the Mifo's are not. Well designed, extremely usable and intuitive and they sound fantastic. I plan on many bike rides with these pumping out hip hop or rock while allowing external sounds in. Thank you Jabra, very few companies make products this exceptional..
customer_reviews.author: Von Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Jabra is severely underrated.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, but let's set expectations. 1) These don't have noise cancellation, but you can get a good seal so that doesn't matter. 2) The battery life is OK, but you need to make sure to have your case charged and to put them back in there at a predictable interval. If you want true wireless earbuds, these are good. If you want better battery life, Jabra has several other Bluetooth sets that are cheaper and just as good. These, if anything show the brand is worth exploring for the product that fits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Timmons

product_meta.title: Jabra Elite 65t Earbuds – Alexa Built-In, True Wireless Earbuds with Charging Case, Titanium Black – Bluetooth Earbuds Engineered for the Best True Wireless Calls and Music Experience
product_meta.description: Color:Titanium Black| Style:Elite 65t| Pattern Name:SingleListen to your favorite tunes and have crystal clear conversations within the Jabra Elite 65t Earbuds. These headphones are engineered for the best true wireless calls and music experience. The 4-microphone technology gives you effective wind noise reduction on calls, and the advanced speakers are just 6mm in size, allowing you to block out, or let in, ambient sound. Plus, the integrated controls let you answer calls, adjust the volume or pause music with just the touch of a button. Whether you’re using these as iPhone earbuds, Samsung earbuds or more, you can listen to your music the way you want to hear it, by personalizing your sound on the Jabra Sound+ app, choosing how Sound+ delivers your sound and how it looks. Earbuds are Apple and Android compatible, so you can choose your preferred voice assistant from Amazon Alexa, Siri, Google Assistant and more. Jabra Elite 65t are third generation true wireless earbuds, and Jabra has a proven track record of excellent true wireless connectivity. Experience the stability that lets you take calls and listen to music without worrying about audio dropouts. And with Bluetooth 5.0 in these wireless earbuds, you can seamlessly connect them to your smartphone, making them ideal for students and professionals to use while learning and working from home. Whatever your listening needs are, you can use these earbuds all day. With up to 5 hours of battery on a single charge, and up to 15 hours in total with the included pocket-friendly charging case, your listening needs are met from the start of the day, to its end. Plus, it’s comfortable. 3 sets of EarGels in different sizes are included, so you can choose the right size to ensure great sound quality in every circumstance. Microphone sensitivity: -38 dBV/Pa Verified by Delta, December 15th – 2017.
feature_bullets: True wireless earbuds – Conversations are made incredibly clear with the Jabra Elite 65t true wireless earbuds that are proven to deliver superior call performance. Plus, a long-lasting battery with charging case included keeps you connected all day.

Multi-functional Bluetooth earbuds – The integrated controls let you answer calls, adjust the volume or pause music with just the touch of a button. Plus, they are IP55 rated with a 2-year warranty against water and dust (registration required).

Take work calls from home – Incredible 4-microphone technology offers best-in-class call performance, with up to 15 hours of battery for maximum productivity— Even when you’re learning or working from home on your smartphone.

No audio dropouts – With our excellent record of connectivity, you can take calls and listen to music without worry of audio dropouts. Plus, external ambient sound keeps you aware of surroundings and a Background noise filter delivers crisp, clear calls.

Personalize your sound – Whether you’re using these as Apple earbuds, Samsung earbuds or more, you can listen to your music the way you want to hear it, by personalizing your sound on the Jabra Sound+ app. Earbuds are Apple and Android compatible.
